info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 24 at 8:15PM CDT until October 24 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Kimble and Menard.
* WHEN...Until 1115 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 812 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms extending across western Menard county including Fort Mckavett to 5 miles west of Roosevelt, moving east at 35 mph. These storms will moving into Menard and Junction. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Junction, Menard, Yates Crossing, London, South Llano River State Park, Saline, Segovia, Roosevelt, Hext, Telegraph, Fort Mckavett, Us-83 Near The Kimble-Menard County Line, Cleo, The Intersection Of Us-83 And Ranch Road 1773, The Intersection Of Us-83 And Highway 29, Us-377 Near The Kimble-Menard County Line, Camp Sol Mayer, Us-83 Near The Kerr-Kimble County Line, I-10 Near The Sutton-Kimble County Line and Us-377 Near The Kimble-Edwards County Line. - This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 434 and 477.
This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Park Road 73 crossing South Llano River, US HWY 377 crossing South Llano River, Toe Nail crossing San Saba River, RM 385 crossing Falls Prong, RM 385 crossing Perdenales River, FM 2169 crossing Johnson Fork Creek, Decker St. crossing San Saba River, US HWY 377 crossing 2 miles North of Telegraph, RM 2291 crossings along Bear Creek and crossings along FM 1221. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT THIS EVENING
